subtitle: This pie can be served hot or cold. Lovely with a dollop of creme fraiche.

method.text: Sift the flour and cinnamon together into a bowl. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.
Add the egg and enough cold water to form a soft but not sticky dough. Knead lightly until smooth. Wrap in cling film and chill for 30 min.
Roll out <sup>2</sup>/<sub>3</sub> of the pastry on a lightly floured surface and use to line a 18 cm pie plate.
Mix together the cherries, cinnamon and lemon rind and sugar to taste. Spoon into the pastry case.
Roll out the remaining pastry for the lid. Dampen the pastry edge before using to cover the filling. Flute the edges and make a hole in the centre of the pie to release any steam.

Mix together the chopped nuts, Demerara sugar, flour and cinnamon. Rub in the butter. Glaze the top of the pie with the beaten egg. Sprinkle over the topping and bake for 30-40 min or until cooked and golden brown.
Dredge with a little caster sugar.

title: Cherry cinnamon pie
